ygData.subject: Re: AW: [Bristlebane_EQ] AW: [Bristlebane_EQ] AW: [Bristlebane_EQ] po ssible weekly trade f estival...
ygData.msgSnippet: Aye, it would be good to have the trade festival taking place in Freeport, but the evil races (i.e. you and me!) couldn t attend it. That is why the event is
ygData.messageBody:
Aye, it would be good to have the trade festival taking place in
Freeport, but the evil races (i.e. you and me!) couldn't attend it.
That is why the event is being based at the Shady Swashbuckler's cave,
so that anyone who want to attend, can attend. The Shady Swashbuckler
is indifferent to pretty much anyone, and will trade with anyone from a
high elf paladin to a dark elf shadow knight, he's not picky.

If you get to around 20th any time soon, give me a yell, I'll hunt with
you.

One last thing - why do people in the Oasis insist on training sand
giants into other people before they die? Can't they have the good
grace to just die AWAY from the medditating mages? Just something that
bugs me : )

--- "Proplesch, Carsten" <GER7CBP@...> wrote:
> From: "Proplesch, Carsten" <GER7CBP@...>
>
> hm..thnx for that info...but the point i ment was
> that u plan to make a big

> freeport..or is that info wrong?
> the tunnel is familiar to me...i was once in ur
> beautiful city of neriak and
> liked it very much.....btw i would like to group up
> sometimes with some
> necros around lvl 14-17 to go to lavastorm and rock
> some monsters
> there....so if somebody is interested please give me
> a tell...and write from
> which timezone u are cause i am from germany and
> need to compare ur times
> with mine...
> info:
>
> german time zone is 6 hours advanced from east coast
> time and 9 hours
> advanced from west coast time zone...ok?
>
> agedon, lvl 15 necromancer of the beautyful city of
> akkon....
>
> "the path of the dark is covered by lots of fallen
> by their feet, they dont
> make them stumble, just smile....about their deeds"
>
> -----Ursprï¿½ngliche Nachricht-----
> Von: Mark Bourland [mailto:bourland@...]
> Gesendet am: Montag, 14. Juni 1999 20:17
> An: Bristlebane_EQ@onelist.com
> Betreff: Re: [Bristlebane_EQ] AW: [Bristlebane_EQ]
> AW: [Bristlebane_EQ]
> possible weekly trade f estival...
>
> From: "Mark Bourland" <bourland@...>
>
> >sure i have invisibility, but the prob is, when i
> am invis.how can we start
> >a trade or something like that??not all char have
> infravison and see
> >invisible or?thats the point i mean...
>
>
> In the tunnel from North Ro to East Commonlands,
> there is no danger for a
> necromancer by NPCs. I am a Dark Elf Necromancer
> and go at will between the
> two zones via this tunnel. I've even traded with
> the only NPC there and
> have not been attacked. A gnome such as yourself
> should be more liked than
> me, thus I don't think you should have any problem.
> Thus your only concern
> is getting through Freeport to the tunnel, which
> isn't very hard either. If
> you have Gather Shadows, then use it and you won't
> have to worry about
> guards or any other Freeport citizen. Head south
> from the South gate of
> Freeport (actually within East Freeport zone) and
> enter North Ro, then
> follow the right zone wall and you'll find the
> tunnel easily. Keep going
> until you find an open area with the Swashbuckler
> inside (and hopefully
> everyone else that is there to trade). The
> alternate route is to stay
> invisible and make your way from East Freeport to
> West Freeport and then to
> East Commonlands where you can follow the left zone
> wall and you'll find the
> tunnel inset in a hill. Shouldn't be too hard.
>
> -Kendrath
>
